Articles.Content: It took me a long time but I just figured out how to get out of the suns orbit. Im still flying right now at 271,000,000,000 m from the sun at 7,469 m/s. Im wondering if anyone else has accomplished this ?
It\'s actually quite simple, I\'ve achieved it numerous times.
ok i just wasn\'t sure because I haven\'t seen any videos or forums about it ?
Check in the challenges section, there\'s actually quite a few there.

Ive done it.

going 200000 M/S, no lie

Proof:

![29wokjk.png](http://i48.tinypic.com/29wokjk.png)
Doing that is much easier than going to the mun...in my opinion

Here\'s a shot of Kerbol at a few billion km away:

> ![9hdrQ.png](http://i.imgur.com/9hdrQ.png)

And I\'m still getting light glare...

This is my test for a new rocket design usually. I send it straight up with the main liquid fuel engines, and then turn over and burn prograde for the solar orbit. Once the first stage is done, I turn around and use a high efficiency liquid engine facing backwards to get the rest of the way out of orbit. If it doesn\'t work, it probably need MOAR BOOSTERS!
